job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Privacy Engineering team is looking for a Fullstack Developer to deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks.The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle. As a member of this team, you will become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains. You will work with a global team to build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams.

   Role:

   The privacy engineering team is looking to expand the team's skillset into full-stack development, with the goal of optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process with new tools:

     * Automation of privacy management: Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance. Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.
     * Privacy by Design: Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, e.g. by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes. Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle.
     * Privacy Scanners: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information. Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata. Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers.
     * Privacy Architecture and Privacy-aware Product Design: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques. Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.
job_details.full_text:
Full Stack Developer( Python)

The Privacy Engineering team is looking for a Fullstack Developer to deliver the next generation of our Privacy by Design process, which will focus on automating privacy compliance tasks.The Privacy Engineering function is part of the Product Trust team that works on addressing Privacy, Security, and OSS from the earliest stages of the product development lifecycle. As a member of this team, you will become the subject matter expert for privacy but can also expand into the license compliance and security domains. You will work with a global team to build infrastructure, automation tooling, drive improvement to compliance, and inform best practices for development teams.

   Role:

   The privacy engineering team is looking to expand the team's skillset into full-stack development, with the goal of optimizing and automating the privacy compliance process with new tools:

     * Automation of privacy management: Design and develop tools and infrastructure to help privacy specialists, developers, product owners, product managers, account executives achieve privacy compliance. Design and develop tools to facilitate compliance verification and auditing.
     * Privacy by Design: Optimize how different stakeholders interface with the privacy by design process, e.g. by automating manual tasks, in alignment with the broader Product Trust processes. Shape company-wide processes to integrate privacy by design principles and 'shift privacy left' in the product development lifecycle.
     * Privacy Scanners: develop privacy risk estimation scanner both analyzing data and code such as automatic detection of directly and indirectly identifiable information. Build infrastructure and tools to collect privacy-related metadata. Analyze metadata to produce insights for executives and decision makers.
     * Privacy Architecture and Privacy-aware Product Design: Support product designers and architect implementing privacy by design principles such as data minimization or implementing privacy enhancing techniques. Bridge team and compliance needs by defining appropriate privacy mitigations in collaboration with the Privacy Office.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on developing tools and infrastructure to automate privacy compliance tasks and integrate privacy by design principles. While it involves software development and potentially some data analysis for risk estimation, it does not heavily emphasize core ML/GenAI modeling, engineering, or deployment in the way an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer role would. The primary goal is compliance automation and process optimization, rather than building predictive or generative AI models. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's primarily a software development role focused on a specific domain (privacy engineering) rather than a core AI/ML engineering role.
